text:
<@UHDQQ4GN6> good question…looks like the discrepancy actually gets worse. For Kron of two 5x5 matrices:
```  440.536 ns (6 allocations: 768 bytes) # Kronecker.jl using Matrix
  151.496 ns (1 allocation: 288 bytes)  # dense matvec using Matrix
  600.376 ns (14 allocations: 1.19 KiB) # Kronecker.jl using SMatrix
  33.930 ns (0 allocations: 0 bytes)    # dense matvec using SizedMatrix```
The last timing uses a SizedMatrix, which is what `kron` of two SMatrices returns

<@U01PLQWQXPV> I see some overhead for matvecs with small matrices. I think this is also observed in Kronecker.jl’s timings (see <https://github.com/MichielStock/Kronecker.jl/blob/master/benchmark.svg>). I think the code for matvecs is in <https://github.com/MichielStock/Kronecker.jl/blob/master/src/multiply.jl>.

edit: I’m seeing similar overhead using a hardcoded multiply, transpose, multiply approach, so maybe this is unavoidable for small matrices.
